name: GetFileCountInFolder
description:
Retrieve the count of all files in a specified folder.

This tool is used to obtain the count of files within a specified directory for a given project. Call this tool when you need to know how many files are present in a specific folder.

parameters.name: file_system_uuid
parameters.description: A UUID string identifying the file system to get the file count.

value_schema.description: A UUID string identifying this file system.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: Project ID for accessing the desired project. Use /api/projects/ to find the ID.

value_schema.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.

parameters.name: file_system_request
parameters.description: A JSON object containing details about the file system, including 'id', 'path', 'depth', and other parameters.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the PostHog API.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A UUID string identifying this file system.

value_schema.description: A UUID string identifying this file system.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.

value_schema.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.
